name: verifyUpdateBookWithoutFullFields
description: Verify  book information can be updated with different field values.
descriptionHtml: Verify book information can be updated with different field values.
statusMessage:
[New book fields should match] 
Expecting actual:
  Book(id=922800, title=Clean Code, description=, pageCount=0, excerpt=null, publishDate=2026-01-30T22:42:02Z)
to be equal to:
  Book(id=922800, title=Clean Code, description=, pageCount=null, excerpt=null, publishDate=2026-01-30T22:42:02Z)
when recursively comparing field by field, but found the following difference:

field/property 'pageCount' differ:
- actual value  : 0
- expected value: null

The recursive comparison was performed with this configuration:
- no equals methods were used in the comparison EXCEPT for java JDK types since introspecting JDK types is forbidden in java 17+ (use withEqualsForType to register a specific way to compare a JDK type if you need it)
- these types were compared with the following comparators:
  - java.lang.Double -> DoubleComparator[precision=1.0E-15]
  - java.lang.Float -> FloatComparator[precision=1.0E-6]
  - java.nio.file.Path -> lexicographic comparator (Path natural order)
- actual and expected objects and their fields were compared field by field recursively even if they were not of the same type, this allows for example to compare a Person to a PersonDto (call strictTypeChecking(true) to change that behavior).
- the introspection strategy used was: DefaultRecursiveComparisonIntrospectionStrategy
